events.message: The applicant submitted their personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and debt consolidation.
The loan application was reviewed and categorized appropriately under personal loans based on the applicant's stated use.
A loan officer was assigned promptly to handle the applicant’s personal loan request and initiate further procedures.
The assigned loan officer conducted an initial review of the application, checking completeness and eligibility criteria.
Additional documentation was requested from the applicant, including proof of income and medical bills, to support the loan case.
The applicant submitted all requested documents, including recent pay stubs and detailed medical invoices for review.
A credit bureau check was performed, revealing a good credit score with some outstanding personal debts being managed on time.
The risk assessment was carried out, evaluating the applicant’s ability to repay based on income, debts, and credit score data.
An offer detailing loan terms, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for consideration.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer, requesting minor clarifications about payment flexibility options.
Due to the applicant’s request for flexible repayment terms, the case was escalated to the senior loan committee for review.
The senior loan committee approved the personal loan application with adjusted repayment options as requested by the applicant.
The approved loan amount was successfully funded and disbursed into the applicant’s bank account as agreed.
A routine post-approval follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant is managing repayments and address any concerns.
The loan application process was formally closed following successful funding and initial repayment scheduling.
